story:
The undergraduate student project, alterNATIVE education is requesting $10,000 to pay for travel and per diem for ten students to provide a week-long peer-education and mentorship program for high school students  this summer on three reservations in New Mexico.

WHO WE ARE 

AlterNATIVE Education is the first Native, intercollegiate, peer-education and mentorship initiative/organization aimed at bridging the gap between NATIVE [american] Highschool and NATIVE college students.  

AlterNATIVE Education was formed by us, 10 undergraduates of Columbia University. We represent 12 Native nations and non-Native allies.

After learning about Native education in our own communities and communities across the nation, we believe that a 61% high school graduation rate among Native Americans is everyone's concern: every community's, every individual's, every educator's, every [grand]parent's, cousin's and friend's. AlterNATIVE Education is not the answer, but it is our vision of a moment when we stop lamenting statistics and begin doing something about them.

 

WHAT WE DO 

We have developed a week-long summer curriculum for high school students to be provided at no cost to participating tribes or volunteers; this curriculum is aimed at Engaging students with Native histories, Native governments, Native arts and Native
current events, topics that are not talked about often enough in the classroom; Empowering Native students as community members, as individuals, as agents of change; and finally, Encouraging Native students to seriously consider pursuing higher education. We will do this through:

Mentorship
Fostering on-going mentorship relationships between high-school students and ourselves as college students is our first and foremost goal. These relationships formed in the summer week will continue beyond the program through correspondences, programming, and collaboration.

Native education
Getting students to engage with the History, Present, & Future of Native Presence, Action, & movements for change. We will read primary sources, artistic interpretations, and critically look at contemporary representations of Native peoples.

Community project
Working with individual communities/nations/tribes, we will collaborate with Native students to create a service project that the students will lead, execute, and continue beyond the week-long session.

 

LONG TERM GOALS 

Sustainability
Because on-going mentorship with students is our primary goal, facilitating lasting relationships between these students and the ten students here and now is fundamental.
Beyond that we hope to maintain relationships with the 3 original tribes, returning year after year, engaging new mentors, new mentees, and reinforcing relationships already made.
Expansion
We hope to expand on-the-ground efforts to more tribes, creating chapters at more universities, always at no cost to the participants and their families.
We further would like to launch an online accessibility, where individual students, tribes, parents, cousins, and community leaders might reach out, access and support AlterNATIVE Education.
story_txt:
The undergraduate student project, alterNATIVE education is requesting $10,000 to pay for travel and per diem for ten students to provide a week-long peer-education and mentorship program for high school students  this summer on three reservations in New Mexico.


WHO WE ARE 
AlterNATIVE Education is the first Native, intercollegiate, peer-education and mentorship initiative/organization aimed at bridging the gap between NATIVE [american] Highschool and NATIVE college students.  
AlterNATIVE Education was formed by us, 10 undergraduates of Columbia University. We represent 12 Native nations and non-Native allies. After learning about Native education in our own communities and communities across the nation, we believe that a 61% high school graduation rate among Native Americans is everyone's concern: every community's, every individual's, every educator's, every [grand]parent's, cousin's and friend's. AlterNATIVE Education is not the answer, but it is our vision of a moment when we stop lamenting statistics and begin doing something about them.
 
WHAT WE DO 
We have developed a week-long summer curriculum for high school students to be provided at no cost to participating tribes or volunteers; this curriculum is aimed at Engaging students with Native histories, Native governments, Native arts and Native current events, topics that are not talked about often enough in the classroom; Empowering Native students as community members, as individuals, as agents of change; and finally, Encouraging Native students to seriously consider pursuing higher education. We will do this through:
Mentorship Fostering on-going mentorship relationships between high-school students and ourselves as college students is our first and foremost goal. These relationships formed in the summer week will continue beyond the program through correspondences, programming, and collaboration.
Native education Getting students to engage with the History, Present, & Future of Native Presence, Action, & movements for change. We will read primary sources, artistic interpretations, and critically look at contemporary representations of Native peoples.
Community projectWorking with individual communities/nations/tribes, we will collaborate with Native students to create a service project that the students will lead, execute, and continue beyond the week-long session.
 
LONG TERM GOALS 
Sustainability Because on-going mentorship with students is our primary goal, facilitating lasting relationships between these students and the ten students here and now is fundamental. Beyond that we hope to maintain relationships with the 3 original tribes, returning year after year, engaging new mentors, new mentees, and reinforcing relationships already made. Expansion We hope to expand on-the-ground efforts to more tribes, creating chapters at more universities, always at no cost to the participants and their families.We further would like to launch an online accessibility, where individual students, tribes, parents, cousins, and community leaders might reach out, access and support AlterNATIVE Education.

story:
The Bethlehem Children’s School is an independent school for children age three through eighth grade established in 1995 to provide a positive learning experiences for children. The idea behind our school is that children want to learn, and can do so best in a cooperative multi-age environment, with little stress, more attention from a teacher, and where inquiry-based learning is determined by a child's developmental readiness; the idea is that an initial nurturing educational environment fosters the development of a genuine, life-long passion for learning. The idea also includes the notion of being green - and where each child is encouraged to be a steward of the planet - not just our small corner of the Capital Region of New York State.

Our school has just launched an ambitious capital campaign, and if the ideas that provide our school its foundation resonate with you, we welcome your support. Our capital campaign is designed to secure the school's future for many years to come. We have set a very ambitious target of $325,000 to accomplish all that is needed, and to ensure that The Bethlehem Children’s School will be able to continue and grow. Through the help of supporters like you, we hope to raise $75,000 of that goal.

We need you. Your support now is vital to our continued existence - both as an idea and as a physical entity. The past few years have been tough on any number of independent schools and nonprofits. Your commitment to The Bethlehem Children's School will allow us – literally - to go on. The security you can provide by your gift to the school will be felt for years to come.

If you are interested in naming opportunities at The Bethlehem Children’s School, or in honoring someone with a tribute or memorial gift, please contact us.

The Bethlehem Children’s School welcomes items of tangible personal property that be used in one or more of the school’s programs. Donors can receive a charitable deduction for the item’s market value. Please contact us for details.

Many companies will match or multiply donations from their employers (in some cases, an employee’s spouse). Contact your employer’s personnel office to determine whether your company participates in a matching gift program to request the necessary forms.

We would be delighted to speak with you about additional giving opportunities, such as gifts of securities, deferred gifts, and bequests. Please let us know if you would like to speak with us about one of these options.

All contributions are tax deductible. The Bethlehem Children’s School is an educational nonprofit, recognized as a Federal Tax Exempt Organization under IRS code section 501(c)(3); our identification number is available upon request.

We invite your support of a small, vibrant, creative educational community – a little school that offers a BIG education. And we thank you very much.

story:
Help fund the EDUCATION FOR THE FUTURE and plant TREES FOR THE FUTURE.

Let us introduce ourselves... Mike Hejmej, Mark McGinnley and John Bezear. We are the founders of Universal Classroom Inc and creators of MATHDUNK.COM.  Life brought us together from different countries and our collective passion for helping people has resulted in chasing our dream together. We are 3 young aspiring entrepreneurs out to make a difference in peoples lives by providing an educational platform that will help students across the globe.

We know that there are plenty of educational websites out there...but  MATHDUNK.COM IS DIFFERENT

  • Mathdunk combines a social platform with perfect math notation.
  • It transcends international borders and has the potential to connect students from all over the world in one central community.

We have put in thousands of hours of sweat into building our website (BETA SITE http://mathdunk.com/)  and we need your funding to take it to the next level.  We have also reached the upper limits of our programing ability and need to source professional help for the next improvements.  Donations will help fund the following:

  • Important re-writes and updates to mathdunk.com (70%)
  • Update 1 - Building a gate page
  • Update 2 - Embedding group capabilities
  • Mathdunk tokens - Mathdunk tokens will be a virtual currency that people exchange to help each other [kind of like hug coupons]
  • Marketing and advertising for launch (30%) Social media and online campaign.

OUR PERKS ARE UNIQUE...We decided that we would like to be socially responsible from the get-go and GIVE BACK straight away.  We are partnering with TREES FOR THE FUTURE and forwarding up to 50% of donations.  

http://www.treesforthefuture.org  "As an agroforestry resource center, we work with local farmers and community groups to help them better support themselves, and to restore degraded lands to sustainable productivity by planting trees that not only thrive in poor soil conditions, but that also benefit the local area in a multitude of ways. Through our worldwide network of technicians, volunteers, and community leaders, we help rehabilitate environments across the globe."

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD! We understand not everyone can make a donation.  We would love it if you can follow us on Twitter and Facbook. Dont forget the AWESOME Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out.

story:
Unfuck The World. What does that mean?

It means get up, go out and do something. It means find out what you are passionate about, what change you would like to see, in your street, your community, your city, it means reach out to like minded people and realize you are not alone.

What does Unfuck The World do?

Unfuck The World helps with creating local chapters by organizing events: donation drives at homeless shelters, days of free hair cuts for the men and women on skid row, the installation of community gardens or art shows benefitting someone in need. (If you click on the Gallery tab above, you can see some pictures of the events.)

What is the goal of the fundraiser?

The money raised will fund four international concerts that will be watched on YouTube on June 8, 2013. The goal of the concerts is to inspire and connect people who desire to make a positive change in their communities and throughout the world.

Where We're From & Where We're Going

A message from our founder

Hey,

My name is Maike. I’m a German living in Los Angeles, and my background is in film production. In September of 2006, to make a difference, I began to sell Unfuck The World t-shirts. I didn’t envision a movement then; all I wanted was to donate proceeds from sales to charity.

Over the years, the idea began to take on a life of its own. We started a YouTube channel and created an Unfuck The World Facebook Page that now has more than 15,000 Likes. People began to ask us: What can I do to unfuck the world? How can I become part of the movement?

About a year ago, a supporter from Canada brought up the idea for an Unfuck The World Day to spread the word and raise awareness. What a great idea! Somebody else suggested we make it a day of live music from around the globe, that anybody anywhere in the world can watch as long as they have a computer or cellphone. An even greater idea!

In addition to live bands, we’re also inviting inspirational speakers to talk about issues they’re passionate about, and we are asking bands from around the world to send us video clips of their performances, so we can add it to the UTW Day YouTube channel.

The proceeds from ticket sales will benefit local causes, chosen by the people organizing and participating in the event, so that they can make an impact in their communities.  

We set the date for the Unfuck The World Day: June 8, 2013. Right now, people in four countries on three continents are already laying the groundwork for the concerts — Europe: Reykjavik and London; Australia: Brisbane; and USA: Los Angeles.

 

Our goal is to raise $30,000 for this first annual Unfuck The World Day. 

We are offering some pretty cool perks as a sign of our gratitude, and I know that with your help, we will make it happen!

What if you are completely broke and want to help? No problem! We need you to talk about Unfuck The World Day, at school, at work, in your local coffee shop and most important, on social websites. We can not do this without your support!

If you have any questions whatsoever, please don't hesitate to contact me. I promise I will respond to each email personally and quickly.

Please join us in making Unfuck The World Day a global success! 

Sincerely,
 
Maike Both and the Unfuck The World Team

story:
WHAT IS THE CAPILANO U INTERACTIVE DESIGN PROGRAM ALL ABOUT?

Capilano University’s Interactive Design program trains students to be designers and developers to fulfill the demand in the robust web industry in Vancouver. Due to a $1.2 million dollar budget deficit, programs including Interactive Design are scheduled to be suspended.

On May 14th, the Board of Governors directed the University Senate Budget Sub-Committee to attempt to produce a balanced budget without program cuts by their June 10th meeting. That goal was not reached in favour of the programs at stake.

The Interactive Design program at Capilano University is the best program of its kind in BC, with a phenomenal success rate in sending well-trained graduates into the technology sector of British Columbia. Helping transition BC's economy toward innovation and growth in high-tech.

This kickstarter has been organized by students who have incubated a mobile app with the Interactive Design program and see many opportunities for other students to have the same applied experience as they did. 

Faculty and students have come together in order to advocate reinstating the program and collaboratively #SaveINTE 

www.saveinte.ca

Note: This fundraising campaign is not organized by or affiliated with Capilano University. It is organized by a student from the School of Business at Capilano University, Myles Galvin, and an instructor from the School of Business, Cyri Jones. We want to do our part to help save this important program!

What We Need & What You Get

To thank contributors, we have some perks to offer! 

All funds raised by this campaign will be presented to Capilano University's Board with a request that the funds be applied to the Interactive Design program.

If we don't reach our goal to save the Interactive Design Program, we will give all funds raised to Capilano University to be used for other important student programs being cut or for student scholarships and bursaries. If we raise more funds beyond our goal, we will contribute the extra funds to help save other student program at Capilano University being cut or put into student scholarships and bursaries.

www.saveinte.ca

#SaveINTE

The Impact

Some quotes from students, faculty and industry partners to paint a picture on what this program means to the future of Capilano University and the Vancouver tech industry.

  • "WE FEEL AS IF WE DISCOVERED GOLD ON CAMPUS."
    • MYLES GALVIN, CAPILANO SMALL BUSINESS ASSOCIATION

  • "THIS IS ONE OF THE MOST INNOVATIVE AND VALUABLE PROGRAMS AT CAPILANO UNIVERSITY."
    • CYRI JONES, ZENPORTFOLIOS

  • "I OWE ALL OF MY SUCCESS TO THIS PROGRAM."
    • MATT VAGUE, METALAB

  • "RUN, NOT WALK, TO THE NEAREST INTERACTIVE PROGRAM"
    • KRISTEN CURRENTLY ENROLLED

  • "INTERACTIVE DESIGN HAS PLAYED AN INTEGRAL ROLE IN THE GROWTH OF IDEA REBEL."
    • JAMIE GARRATT, IDEA REBEL

  • "WE HAVE ONE OF THE BEST PROGRAMS IN THE UNIVERSITY, IF ANYTHING IT SHOULD BE LOOKED AT AS ONE OF ITS CROWN JEWELS."
    • PARKER BUSSWOOD FRONT-END ENGINEER, EAST SIDE GAMES

  • "LEARN TO CODE. YOU WON'T REGRET IT."
    • HANK LEBER CEO & CO-FOUNDER GONNABE
  • "THE VAST MAJORITY OF GRADUATES OF THIS PROGRAM GET JOBS. GOOD, LONG TERM JOBS."
    • DAVID RANKIN

  • "FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE, CODING IS ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT AND DESIRABLE SKILLS THERE IS."

    • ASHER HUNT, LEAD MOBILE DESIGNER, LIVEPERSON

  • "THE GOAL IS TO PUT PEOPLE IN THE WORK FORCE AND BE EMPLOYABLE, WE LOOK TO THESE PROGRAMS FOR OUR NEW STARS."
    • JASON BAILEY, CEO, EAST SIDE GAMES

  • "THIS PROGRAM IS VALUABLE TO BOTH INDUSTRY AND STUDENTS. IT IS A PROVEN WINNER. CUTTING IT IS MORE THAN UNFORTUNATE BUT MISGUIDED."
    • ALVIN WASSERMAN, PRESIDENT, WASSERMAN+PARTNERS


  • "GREAT PROGRAM - OUR SON IS A VERY SUCCESSFUL GRAD OF THIS PROGRAM."
    • KENT BROWNLOW, PARENT 

  • AS AN ALUMNUS I STAND TO LOSE MY BIGGEST NETWORK, FRESH TALENT COMING OUT OF THE PROGRAM."
    • JØRGEN HOOKHAM, DESIGNER, SOKANU

  • "I HONESTLY DON'T KNOW WHAT I WOULD BE DOING WITHOUT THE SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE THE PROGRAM HAS GIVEN ME UNDER MY BELT."
    • POYAN BEHBOUDI, INTE GRADUATE, 2013


  • "PEOPLE FROM THE INTE PROGRAM COME READY TO WEAR MANY HATS. CUTTING THIS PROGRAM WOULD LEAVE A BIG GAP."
    • JOSH NILSON, COO, EAST SIDE GAMES


  • "THE WORLD IS HAVING AN ASYMMETRIC EDUCATION PROBLEM, AND YOU ACTUALLY HAVE A PROGRAM WHERE 85% OF STUDENTS GET A JOB."
    • SPENCER THOMPSON, CEO, SOKANU


  • "THE INTERACTIVE DESIGN PROGRAM IS THE REASON I HAVE THE CAREER I DO TODAY, I WOULD BE NOWHERE WITHOUT IT."
    • SEAN PATTERSON, SYSTEM ANALYST, REWARDSTREAM


  • "CODING IS THE NEW LITERACY."
    • HANK LEBER, CEO & CO-FOUNDER GONNABE


  • IT'S THE BATTLE OF THE TECH LITERATE VS. THE TECH ILLITERATE.
    • HANK LEBER, CEO & CO-FOUNDER GONNABE

The Interactive Deisgn program has mastered the art of transforming students into highly sought after industry members. The skills, knowledge and experiences the students recieve is cutting edge and remarkable. Seeing how much the students grow and excel in such a short amount of time is astonishing.

This program is helping to shape the landscape of the technology industry in Vancouver and consequentially the world. 

www.saveinte.ca

#SaveINTE

Other Ways You Can Help

Just want to thank you for your interest in helping the Interactive Design program at Capilano University. With your help we will be able to ensure this program runs and continues to grow and thrive. Thank you for your help.

If a donation is not possible, we would love if you could share our campaign with some folks you know who may be interested. 

Feel free to email, tweet or facebook the campaign link to help us continue to spread the word.

Forever thankful! 

www.saveinte.ca

#SaveINTE

story:
HOTEP’s Summer Peace Program

Hi I’m Dr. Ural Hill  a minister of the gospel of Jesus Christ and a Licensed Professional Counselor. I am also the President of Healing Ourselves through Escellence and Preparation (H.O.T.E.P.) Christian Serives Inc. a faith based community mental health non-profit organization. You can learn more about us on our website www.HOTEPCSI.ORG

We’ve been working with teenagers who have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and their families for the past year. They have a difficult time concentrating, performing well in school, at home and in their communities. Many times their behavior is mistaken for character flaws but they have low levels of dopamine in their brain’s limbic systems which makes it difficult for them to make logical and rational decisions. We teach these families conflict resolution strategies and how to parent children and adolescents with ADHD. We found that by educating their families on parenting strategies that work, making sure that they have been prescribed the correct medications and teaching them strategies of maximizing effective decision making, their disorder can be managed. During the school year we provide facilitation in their schools with the administration to make sure these kids have the proper accommodations afforded them by law. These same "problem" kids can live productive and focused lives.

 

From July 2012 to March 2013 we treated 7 teenagers and their families who were all faced with these behavioral challenges. After  9 months 5 of the families are functioning very well and the young men are doing well in school, at home and in the communities. The counseling services that we provided were paid for through a pilot project of our local county government, however the county ran out of funding and contract ended in March. There are now two families that still need and have requested our help and two new families requesting our assistance. We the members of HOTEP, our 501(c)3 non-profit organization give God the Glory for the success of the first five families and we're believing that we can raise the money to assist these new five families this summer. Your help will allow us to provide much need mental health services and family counseling to indigent families who would not otherwise get this assistance.

 

We need $5,000 in order to serve them throughout the summer and to prepare them for the next school year. We will provide:

5 psychotherapeutic counseling sessions each month, 2 individual & 1 family session both @ $50 cost and $100 value , 1 parenting session and 1 group social skills outing both @ $200 cost and $300 value.

That’s $550 X 4 families for the cost of therapy X 2 Months July and August of 2013, $4,400

The other $600 will go to gasoline and refreshments for group sessions, group outings for the parents and kids.

If we don’t reach our entire goal it means that we cannot serve as many families. We are already serving two families out of our pockets with one session per week. We really need you help so that we can give them a full educative summer. In Our Family Hope Pilot Program we found that when we provide the five sessions to each family, each month that we increase the quality of life greatly by their own report; and reduce the recidivism rate by 70% helping these young men to stay out of trouble and thus out of the criminal justice system.

In today’s there is a New Jim Crow and It’s the Prison Industrial Complex in a Colorblind Society. HOTEP means Peace. Our Program Helps keep our kids engaged, safe and hopeful. It helps them to choose positive, peaceful and productive pathways for life.

story:
Street Smart Kidz Indiegogo Project

Street Smart Kidz was started in November of 2004 with a goal to give  kids the tools to be able to think their way through dangerous  situations. To teach our kids a "Safety First" mind set in their daily  lives, as well as give their parents the resources, FREE OF CHARGE, to  achieve this goal.

Years of research started in July 2000, and has never stopped, and  will continue forever. We have worked and consulted with The RCMP,  The OPP, The CHP, countless Government Medical and Child Welfare organizations.


The Evolution OF "STREET SMART KIDZ"

  • Street Smart Kidz started working with the public, giving 3 hour FREE  courses to 8 year olds to 14 year olds in Jan. 2004

  • 438 kids went through the Street Smart Kidz classroom FREE of charge,  by Sept. 2004

  • Because of popular demand a waiting list was formed, which started at 3 months and was at 15 months when we looked for a another way to get the message out.

  • Shirley Dickie came on board and said "WE must produce a booklet to get the Safety Word out!"  I immediately thought it was brilliant,  Shirley became our most important Director of the Board and we ran  with it, we mailed out over 12,000 Child Safety Booklets, FREE OF  CHARGE, April 2007

  • Demand never, ever stops, even today, it just never stops because  it's FREE and it's quality. Shirley sat me down, and explained we can't keep fund raising for postage to get our OUTSTANDING Child  Safety Booklets out, "Steven , we must go online so families, kids,  schools, community groups and child safety groups can download our information for free. FREE! So that's what we did!

  • Since then we have visited over 100 schools, countless malls, community centres, fall fairs and everywhere else we have been invited to teach. FREE!

  • We have given away over 100,000 free ID Kits and over 25,000 Child Safety Booklets. FREE!

 

We Have A Dream

We want to make a 90 minute documentary concerning Child Safety. An outstanding team was assembled to write our documentary with members from: law enforcement , school officials, and our Street Smart Kidz team. The final script is FANTASTIC!

Street Smart Kidz has Richard Spencer from http://www.richardspencer.com to compose original music. We have Chad Webber from VI Multimedia all set to film the documentary. We have 3 highschool drama student ready to perform. Fire and police departments are ready to provide needed equipment.

All we need is YOU and YOUR HELP to make our dream a reality. Please HELP US make a family documentary where parents and kids can sit together, be entertained and educated while learning about the "tools" that may save their lives.

Visit us at http://www.streetsmartkidz.ca and see what we are all about, watch our FREE videos and use our FREE Child Safety Tools. Even if you can't donate to our project please use our FREE CHILD SAFETY INFORMATION and keep your family safe.

Thank you from the Street Smart Kidz Team!

Steven Baird | Ken Pickett | Shirley Dickie | Melissa Manson | Chad Webber

Brian Goodwin | Jean Spencer | Dr. K. Emmott |  Richard Spencer | Cara Baird

story:
Short Summary

Here are some of the major elements of Be In The Know that set us apart from many of the existing anti-bullying programs:

1.  Be In The Know functions on multiple levels that empower and hold accountable our children, as well as the leadership of their schools and the entire community. It is grounded in accountability, respect, and acknowledgment of positive behavior.  Our program uses consequences as last resorts and focuses on preventative measures such as shifts in daily attitudes and behaviors that promote positive and peaceful communication amongst peer groups.

2.  Be In The Know is a unique program in that not only provides programming to educational institutions through our staff, speakers and curriculum, but also provides direct services to families and communities affected by bullying, teen suicide and school violence through the incorporation of community services and resources.

3.  Be In The Know has educational programming that is tailored to the needs of students, educators and their particular communities.

What Your Contribution Will Do

We are on our way, but there is so much more to do.  When you contribute, your dollars will be used in the production and distribution of our Teacher Kits.  Teachers and schools have begun to puchase our kits and curriculum, now we need to make sure our production meets their demand!!

The Impact

  • Be In The Know brings services to your community that will cause thousands of people to become more safe and confident. We can protect kids from most abduction attempts and other violence by learning what to watch out for, preparing kids with skills before letting them go anywhere on their own without adult protection, and by ensuring that they have skilled adult supervision while their own skills are still developing.
  • Through education and tailored programing, Be In The Know helps students all over the country to learn how to build an environment and create a language of tolerance and respect that work to combat bullying.

It is grounded in accountability, respect, and acknowledgment of positive behavior.  Our program uses consequences as last resorts and focuses on preventative measures such as shifts in daily attitudes and behaviors that promote positive and peaceful communication amongst peer groups.
2.  Be In The Know is a unique program in that not only provides programming to educational institutions through our staff, speakers and curriculum, but also provides direct services to families and communities affected by bullying, teen suicide and school violence through the incorporation of community services and resources.

The Impact

Be In The Know brings services to your community that will cause thousands of people to become more safe and confident. We can protect kids from most abduction attempts and other violence by learning what to watch out for, preparing kids with skills before letting them go anywhere on their own without adult protection, and by ensuring that they have skilled adult supervision while their own skills are still developing.
Through education and tailored programing, Be In The Know helps students all over the country to learn how to build an environment and create a language of tolerance and respect that work to combat bullying.

story:
During search and rescue missions after a remote area landslide, avalanche or flood in the Nepalese Himalayas our SAR Dog teams face trouble with communicating our activities and the needs of the villagers to our base or the other agencies involved in disaster response. There is no electricity in our base camps and no data transfer due to lack of internet connections. When the batteries of our satellite phones are empty we cannot reach out. If we had a portable small Generator set and a rugged laptop we are able to transmit video cover,photographs and reports about the scale of a remote disaster.
This is the main reason for this campaign.
 
Our SAR Dogs are well trained to enter collapsed buildings or dangerous rock slide areas. We got the skills to do our job. Our organization however is heavily depending on outside funding. See our Mission Statement in order to know more about us.

For those who like what we do and wish to help us in other ways than funding our campaign please use the Indiegogo share tools & ask all friends  and associates to give us the necessary boost. Thank you!

Jit Bahadur Masrangi Magar

Executive Director

SARDOGS NEPAL (NFP)

story:
WHAT IS IMPACT HUB SALT LAKE?

Impact Hub Salt Lake is an open work space, event venue, and innovation lab for people with a purpose. 

Scroll past the "updates" section to learn more about Impact Hub and check out the Backer Reward Cheat Sheet.

 

 

UPDATE 12/10: We Did It Party on Wednesday!

Hey there folks. 

We wanted to let everybody know that our campaign closing party is on Wednesday December 11th. That's tomorrow!

Those of you who have backed the campaign at the Founding Member level and above get into the party for free! 

Check out the details here: http://goo.gl/NGLfu5

 

 

 

UPDATE 11/30: Utah's Leaders Rally Behind Impact Hub

Last week Impact Hub Salt Lake hosted Utah's prominent business, community, and political leaders for a night of thanksgiving. In typical Impact Hub fashion, guests enjoyed live music, locally-sourced hors d'oeuvres, and hand-crafted cocktails. Mayor Ben McAdams displayed his ardent support for Impact Hub Salt Lake and issued a call-to-action for us all: ignite our entrepreneurial ecosystem now!

 

 

 

UPDATE 11/16: Launch Party HUGE Success!

Our Crowdfunding Launch Party was better than we could have ever imagined! We raised over $10K, brought in a diverse audience of over 500 people from the greater Salt Lake area, and raffled off some wonderful giveaways from local sponsors.
 

A huge "THANK YOU" is owed to our bands for the evening: Pablo Blaqk and The War Byrds, Luna Lune, and Westward The Tide.

If you had a great time at this party, look forward to our "We Did It" party on Dec 12. Get it on your calendar now!

 

 

 

 

ABOUT IMPACT HUB SALT LAKE

We are an open work space, event venue, and innovation lab for people with a purpose.

On the surface Impact Hub is an open work space where people just like you - whether you're an entrepreneur, freelancer, or other breed of changemaker - conduct business, hold meetings, teach workshops, host events, design products, and even prepare lunch in our community kitchen.

At its heart though, Impact Hub is much more. 

As an entrepreneurial incubator and community accelerator, Impact Hub provides a diverse range of programming through workshops, classes, and cultural events for mission-driven teams and individuals. 

Community building is further facilitated through a robust "hosting" program, in which Impact Hub hosts connect community members with shared interests and goals to one another. This ensures that Impact Hub is more than just a space, but is a truly collaborative community where creativity and innovation are more than just a topic of conversation, but are actually happening.

Located in the heart of downtown Salt Lake City, Impact Hub Salt Lake is part of a global network of more than 40 Impact Hubs. This gives you access to an incredible amount of intellectual resources, experience, and diverse insights allowing you to amplify your effect in the local community and leave your mark on the world.

Impact Hub Salt Lake is locally owned and operated by a vibrant and talented team with diverse backgrounds. Read more details about the team, and Impact Hub in general, below the Donor Rewards cheat sheet.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

IT'S MORE THAN A SPACE TO WORK

 

 

 

 

Impact Hub Salt Lake members are more than co-workers, they are a tribe, a group of people connected by a common purpose. In this case, the purpose is positive social and sustainable impact in our local community, and the world at large.

Members not only connect on values, but support one another by lending time, leading workshops, hosting events, expressing themselves through art, music, and dance, providing funding and mentorship, launching companies, and prototyping the future.

LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION

This is the fundamental rule of real estate and we're sticking to it. Impact Hub Salt Lake is located in the heart of the downtown commercial district at 150 South State Street, in the historic Zim’s building. 

 

 

Not only are Utah's leading thinkers and doers located in the downtown area, Impact Hub is also right in the middle of Salt Lake's public transit hub. We’re less than a block away from City Creek Center and approximately one block away from the Gallivan and City Center UTA Trax stops.

There are over 1,000 parking spaces within 300 feet for our member's convenience. Additionally our location will provide bicycle storage and motorcycle/scooter parking on site.

 

Impact Hub Salt Lake is lucky to have its very own architect and urban designer on the founding team, Søren Simonsen. Søren was the first LEED Accredited Professional in Utah and has been designing sustainable cities and buildings for two decades.

He is reimagining and designing our 13,000 sq ft space to house an event space, conference rooms, private offices, work lounges, shower and locker facilities, a cafe, kitchen, and over 6,000 sq ft of flexible, open co-working space.

WHO ARE WE?

HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE SPENT?

We've already raised a majority of the funds needed for our buildout, but we need another $50K to put the finishing touches on the space (IT infrastructure, lighting, furniture, and other essential costs). The space needs to be inspiring and beautiful so people will want to work there. Nobody likes working in the dark! 

While $50K would get us what we need, we're confident we can raise more than that, and if we do, we’ll add in some bonuses!

For $75K: We'll install high-quality computer monitors in our open co-working area for all members to enjoy, enabling better digital production and workflow.

For $100K: We'll build out a back patio at the rear of the building, providing a space for members to get outside and work while enjoying the bustle of city life.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES?

 

Currently we’re aiming to open in February 2014. Our biggest concern is that we might push our opening date further out. Every delay or hiccup in funding potentially adds more time to our buildout and will cut into much-needed revenue. We have an amazing partner, our building owner, who has been generous enough to provide space for us at no cost until we open our doors, but this is only a short-term arrangement. We need members in the space to make our model sustainable.

As a security measure, we're also reaching out to businesses in the community to sponsor Impact Hub so we'll reach our financial goals.

 

THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS

story:
Empower youth in Nicaragua with Art & Education!

Hi, we are Wendy, Lucy, Alfonso and Okke, the international team behind the scenes of the Cultural Center . Coming from Guatemala, U.S., Nicaragua and The Netherlands, we met in Managua, Nicaragua in 2011, where the initial idea of a cultural center was born. 

We offer different cultural & artistic classes and activities, such as breakdance, capoeira, percussion, modern dance, arts and crafts using recycled materials, poetry, music, etc. Our bar-café provides us with a platform and helps to finance part of the activities.

Due to the fact that Nicaragua is the second impoverished country in Central America and the majority of youth only receive primary education, there are limited opportunities for youth. Unfortunately, does not have enough resources to provide enough free Art & Education activities for the amount of youth that would like to participate. This is why we need YOUR support for this campaign!!

What Is Needed

through this campaign we hope to raise $3000 usd , to offer capoeira and breakdancing classes and dancing  for free to a group of 40 kids from the area , for  a period of 6 months

What You Get

First of all, our sincere gratitude and more importantly the gratitude of a group of young people that come every day to learn usefull skills and empower their lives.


Secondly, we will provide you with regular updates of how things are progressing here by posting photo´s, videos and written pieces on our Facebook page and our website http://www.culturaquilombo.org/en/

Lastly, you will have a place to visit when you are in Nicaragua and see for yourself the potential of this beautiful country and its people. 

Other Ways You Can Support

If you wish to help but cannot make a financial contribution, there are other ways to provide support. Help us to spread this campaign among your family, friends and colleagues, post it on your Facebook, website, etc. With your support, we can reach our goal!

Unfortunately, does not have enough resources to provide enough free Art & Education activities for the amount of youth that would like to participate. This is why we need YOUR support for this campaign!!



What Is Needed 
through this campaign we hope to raise $3000 usd , to offer capoeira and breakdancing classes and dancing  for free to a group of 40 kids from the area , for  a period of 6 monthsWhat You Get
First of all, our sincere gratitude and more importantly the gratitude of a group of young people that come every day to learn usefull skills and empower their lives.
Secondly, we will provide you with regular updates of how things are progressing here by posting photo´s, videos and written pieces on our Facebook page and our website http://www.culturaquilombo.org/en/
Lastly, you will have a place to visit when you are in Nicaragua and see for yourself the potential of this beautiful country and its people. 


Other Ways You Can Support
If you wish to help but cannot make a financial contribution, there are other ways to provide support. Help us to spread this campaign among your family, friends and colleagues, post it on your Facebook, website, etc. With your support, we can reach our goal!

story:
English and Español

"Just go out there and do what you've got to do."~Martina Navratilova

My name is Alex de Guzman and in August 2012, I did what most people only see in movies...kind of. I quit my job and left all that I loved...friends, family, language, culture, and sport. On top of that, I will be running my first marathon on April 28th in Madrid, Spain. A sport I used to dread. Go figure.

"Sal ahí fuera y haz lo que tengas que hacer."~Martina Navratilova

Me llamo Alex de Guzman. En agosto de 2012 hice algo que sólo se ve en el cine...o algo así. Dejé mi trabajo y dejé todo lo que me era querido...amigos, familia, idioma, cultura, y deport. Así mismo, me dispongo a correr mi pimera maratón el 28 de abril en Madrid (España). Un deporte que solía odiar...imaginaos.

 

"The future depends on what you do today." ~Gandhi

My campaign is called "Race for the Future." I did my first race, a half-marathon, 3 years ago with a few friends. With the help of friends, family, a small start-up called UpCycle Foundation, and Terracyle we were able to raise $800, dontate clothes, and backpacks filled with school supplies, made out of recycled material. With that money, Baruyand Elementary School was able to build a volleyball court which they not only use for sports but for other school events. Those have been "the greates gifts we have ever received."~Lorie Hatulan, principal of Baruyan

My belief is that kids will forever be our future. I've always been fascinated at how obsercant, real, and fun kids truly are. Teaching tennis to young ones has not only kept me grounded and in touch with reality but has also showed how much of an impact you cna have on their future. Since moving to Spain and working with students, I've realized even more how much kids want to learn, especially English. What separates most schools from the rest and their ability to truly succeed is ften times their lack of funding.

After talking to Lorie Hatulan, what the students really need is an "LCD projector to meet quality education and for the pupils to compete globally." This costs about 20,000 pesos; which may seem like a lot but in dollars it's $400. My hope is to provide more.

"El futuro depende de lo que hagas hoy."~Gandhi

Mi campaña se llama "Carrera por el Futuro". Hice mi primera carrera, una media maratón, hace tres años con un puñado de amigos. Con la ayda de familiares, amigos, la pequeña e innovadora Fundación UpCycle, y Terracycle fuimos capaces de recaudar casi 1000 dólares, donar ropa y mochilas repletas de material escolar reciclado. Con esos fondos la Escuela Primaria Baruyan fue capaz de construir una pista de voleibol que usan tanto para deportes como para todo tipo de eventos. Lori Hatulan los ha descrito como los "mejores regalos que hemos recibido".

Creo firmemente que los niños serán por siempre nuestro futuro. Siempre he sentido una fasinación por la perspicacia, honestidad, y simpatía que los niños transmiten. Enseñar tenis a jóvenes no solo me ha mantenido con los pies en el suelp y en contacto con realidad, si no que también me ha demostrado cuánto impacto se puede tener en su futuro. Desde que me he trasladado a España para trabajar con estudiantes me he dado cuenta, aún más si cabe, de su deseo de aprender, especialmente el ingés. Lo que diferencis a unas escuela de otras, e su capacidad de tener éxito, lo cuál siempre está relacionado con sus posibilidades económicas.

Tras hablar con Lori Hatulan, la directora de la escuela, decidimos que para mejorar la calidad de la educación y mejorar la de sus estudiantes con otras escuelas, se necesita un proyector LCD. Dicho proyector cuesta 20.000 pesos. Puede paracer mucho, pero son sólo 400 dólares. Espero ser capaz de ofrecer incluso más.

 

"How wonderful that no one need to wait a single moment to improve the world." ~Anne Frank

Not only will your contributions help me every step of the way during the marathon, but will also have a tremendous impact on a small school thousands of miles away on the island of Mindoro. The children there have so much to offer but can do even more with the right tools.

"¡Qué maravilloso es que nadie necesite esperar ni un solo momento antes de comenzar a mejorar el mundo!"~Anne Frank

Vuestras aportaciones me ayudarán muchísimo durante la maratón, pero también tendrán un grandísimo impacto en una pequeña escuela a miles de kilómetros de distancia, en la isla de Mindoro. ¡Ayudemos el potencial de los niños de Baruyan con las herramientas y recursos adecuados!

 

"A penny saved is a penny earned." ~Benjamin Franklin

20,000 pesos=$400. This will be contributed to the LCD. Anything more will not only make me run faster but also contribute to the schools' supplies and learning conditions.

"Penique ahorrado es penique ganado."~Benjamin Franklin

20.000 pesos=400 dólares. Esto es lo que financiará el proyector LCD. El resto de contribuciones no sólo me qyudarán a correr más rápido, pero también contribuira a mejorar las condiciones de la escuela.

 

"The language of friendship is not words, but meanings." ~Henry David Thoreau

Since moving to Spain, I've not only been learning a new language but have gotten pretty damn good at charades. Fortunately, there are a few words that connect Tagalog, Spanish, and English that make things a bit easier. However, nonverbal communication has been even more key to settling in. For instance random acts of kindness...or even a smile.

"El idioma de la amistad no son las palabras si no los significados."~Henry David Thoreau

Desde que viene a España no sólo he aprendido un nuevo idioma, si no que me he vuelto a buenísima en charadas. Afortunadamente, hay algunas palabras que conectan el español, el inglés, y el tagalo, y que hacen las cosas algo más fáciles. Sin embargo, la comunicación no verbal ha sido in luso más importante para adaptarse a la vida aquí. Un ejemplo es un acto de bondad o incluso una sonrisa.

 

"Only a life lived for others is a life worth while."~Einstein

With your help, these kids at Baruyan will have the opportuniity to connect with other schools. We live in a smaller world where everything is possible, especially given the right resources. My hope is that through your help and communication we can foster the growth and future of many of these kids.

"Sólo una vida vivida por los demás merece la pena ser vivida."~Einstein

Con vuestra ayuda, los niños de Baruyan tendrán la oportunidad de conectar con otras escuelas. Vivimos en un mundo bastante pequeño en el que todo es posible, especialmente con los recursos adecuados. Tengo esperanza de que mediante vuestra ayda y boca a boca podamos mejorar el futuro y el desarrollo de estos niños.

story:
Hi my name is J.C. and I need your help in making a positive impact in the world we live.

In February of 2014, I voluntarily separated from my employer to pursue more purposeful work where I can apply my skills, strengths and experiences to tackling societal needs that affect us all as humans. To kick start this new path in the right direction, I took a chance and paid my way to attend Ashoka U in Providence, RI a few weeks after leaving my promising corporate career path.

That decision has set me on a path to designing the life I want in order to make a difference in the world around me through my social entrepreneurship. It was at this conference where I learned about the The Emzingo Group and their international fellowship programs. After learning about the great social impact, consulting work and responsible leadership development training, I knew I had to apply. So I took another chance by applying and ultimately being accepted. Now the challenges lays in how I fund this. Because it is unfunded and unpaid, I am going to have to really exhaust my savings to go, which I am willing to do because I know deep down in my core that this is a major step in the direction I want to lead my life.

This fellowship is important to me because I can now take my abilities to an international stage and show the world what I can do. After many years of learning through the school of hard knocks, I am a finely tuned innovating machine. I welcome you to visit my site, www.TheEnvisioneer.com to learn more about me and what I am all about.

I really do not know what to expect to come from this fellowship but I can only imagine that upon my return, I will be well on my way to establishing myself as a global entrepreneurial force for good.

Your support in funding my fellowship will go towards the program costs, $3,995 and the required round trip flight to Peru which ranges in the $1,000'ish range plus the Indiegogo fees. I will still be responsible for my financial obligations while I am away for the two months and account for my food and travel expenses while down there. Any additional funds raised outside of my goal will go towards enabling me to return with a financial cushion to figure out my next steps in moving forward to doing my part in making the world a better place through business. In the event, that I fall short of my goal, I will dip into my savings to make this happen and figure out a way to get back on track when I return in August. I am in the process of applying for a nominal scholarship but that is no guarantee so I can use any help I can find.

As a supporter of my fellowship, I will provide weekly updates on my activities and experiences while in Peru and commit to continuing my social impact efforts once I return in whatever capacity I can.

Collectively everyone can contribute towards helping me on this journey, every little bit counts. If you visit my site, you will learn about how I have been involved in social impact projects locally and get a real sense of who I am as a person and why I need to go on this fellowship.

This is my first time leveraging crowdfunding and asking for financial support on something I am passionate about. I have never asked anyone for help financially, even when I was battling cancer midway through my undergrad while working full time so I could finish on time. Everything I have done since that experience has led me to this point and I embrace it for where it will lead me because I know that it is in the direction I want to go.

I thank you in advance for any amount you are able to provide and I look forward to sharing this experience with you. Someday you will see who I become and think to yourself that you played a part in helping make that happen.

If you are unable to contribute financially, I understand, and ask that you share this campaign with your network because every dollar adds up and all we need is 5,000 people to contribute $1 each.

story:
3 years ago we started off with acoustic musicians on the 4th Street sidewalk. By last year Second Sundays on 4th had grown into a monthly event including a stage with some great local bands and a jumpy castle for the kids. Now we're ready to move it to the next level.

Help us reach our dream of creating an event series known all over the Southeast for bringing phenomenal musical acts. 

We believe that downtown Winston-Salem is at a tipping point: pedestrian life has begun to flourish downtown, and our goal is to make sure our downtown comes fully to life.

We can't do this without your help!

Our group is a non-profit organization, and without our community's support, we will not be able to put on these great family events! If you enjoyed coming to an SSO4 last summer, please contribute so we can keep these events going!

A contribution of $10 is all we need from you.

Help us bring bands like Mount Moriah, Diali Cissokho, and lots of other regionally known acts to 4th Street. 


Your contributions will go to cover:
Band/musician booking fees
Permits
Staging and sound
Insurance
Marketing and promotion

These events will also raise funds and awareness for these charities this summer:

  • Arts for Life
  • The Children's Center
  • Loaves & Fishes
  • The Gateway YWCA
  • Imprints for Families
  • The Forsyth Humane Society

Show our city's leaders that we care about good music and we want to have a vibrant and fun downtown!


SSO4 is a true collaborative effort by these businesses on 4th street:
a/perture cinema
Sally Gupton Photography
The Washington Perk
Mellow Mushroom
Camino Bakery
The Less Desirables
Centennial Trading Co.
Millennium Artisan
Jeffrey Adams



Any excess funds will be rolled over for SS04 2015 and help us continue to sustain this annual event!

True Native Perk: a WS tote bag, WS t-shirt, and Camino mug


The $30 "Very Generous" perk


Our official Indiegogo t-shirt.


Super Generous donation gets you a custom designed t-shirt and a $10 gift card from Centennial Trading Co.


A Superbly Generous donations can receive a session + digital files from Sally Gupton Photography. www.sallyguptonphotography.net

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Sasha Grebenyuk and in my spare time, I am helping Jewish community organizations in Boston area to attract and retain new families.  Right now, my biggest challenge is newly opened Center Makor in Natick, MA. Center Makor has just opened his doors to local families with school age kids and their younger siblings in January, 2014. Particialy funded by CJP through Center Makor-Brighton, its Natick branch still needs lot's of support. Since January, we've started several programs for kids and they have been very successful so far: Science Club, Jewish Club, Chess Club, Fine Art, Pianno & Guitar lessons, Puppet Theater and Drama, Russian Poetry, and so on. Some classes can start right away, some classes need extra support to start functioning properly. We've been asked to organize LEGO club, and we've found a teacher and we have students who wants to participate, however, we need the materials for that class. Our estimate is $2000 for the Lego Class Materials that will last for several years. 

Why LEGO? 

Because, it helps you to understand basic engineering principles, physics, material science, and drawing. it brings out the best of your child - his creativity, tallent, ability to imagine things - you name it. With LEGO in place, and Russian Math and Engineering principles, your child is ought to succeed!

What We Need & What You Get

What we need: 

So, we've got the teacher, and we've got the kids. Now what? We're a non-profit and we are trying to deliver affordable education, so we cannot charge $300 - $500 for a semester class, like others would.  We need the materials. We estimated, that we would need to spend around $2000 to aquire necessary lego pieces from local lego store in Natick Mall. Yes, we tried Craigllist already. it's not as cheap as you think either.  If we have any money left from that project, we also need an up-right piano and other supplies for the center. No dime will be spend to the overhead - everything will be dedicated to the programming of our events. 

What you get: 

Our biggest Thank you! If you are a parent, you'll be presented with a voucher, good for a certain amount to be spent at our center. If you are a business, you'll have an opportunity to promote yourself with Center Makor-Natick. Cetner Makor is a 503 non-profit, so all your donations are tax deductible. 


The Impact

It's not a secret anymore - Russian school education creates a better impact on a student and helps student to succeed in college and get a better job after that.  Therefore, Russian Schools of Mathematics are so popular today in the United States. But not only Mathematics, that maters. When we talk about Russian education, we talk about the ways we train our kids to understand science and engineering principles. Kids with skills gained through taking a variety of Russian-originated classes learn faster and in depth, and score higher on the SAT and other tests.  We hope, bringing this center to the Metrowest community of Greater Boston, we are giving a chance to local families to provide their kids with higher level of education at affordable cost.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Share our program on your timeline and in groups - Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin and others.
  • Ask your company management to contribute something on your behalf
  • Tell your friends about Center Makor and invite kids to join us
  • Volunteer your hours to our Center in Natick 
  • Help to spread a word about Center Makor - Natick and its wonderful programs for kids available on a daily basis. 
  • In-kind donations are always welcome! Right now, we are looking for Lego pieces, stand up right piano, and folding tables! 

Thank you very much! Your Involvement is essential for this program to succeed. If you have any questions, please contact me sasha@centermakor.org 

***All Donations are tax deductible***

Some classes can start right away, some classes need extra support to start functioning properly. We've been asked to organize LEGO club, and we've found a teacher and we have students who wants to participate, however, we need the materials for that class. Our estimate is $2000 for the Lego Class Materials that will last for several years. Why LEGO? Because, it helps you to understand basic engineering principles, physics, material science, and drawing. it brings out the best of your child - his creativity, tallent, ability to imagine things - you name it. With LEGO in place, and Russian Math and Engineering principles, your child is ought to succeed!What We Need & What You GetWhat we need: So, we've got the teacher, and we've got the kids. Now what? We're a non-profit and we are trying to deliver affordable education, so we cannot charge $300 - $500 for a semester class, like others would.  We need the materials. We estimated, that we would need to spend around $2000 to aquire necessary lego pieces from local lego store in Natick Mall. Yes, we tried Craigllist already. it's not as cheap as you think either.  If we have any money left from that project, we also need an up-right piano and other supplies for the center. No dime will be spend to the overhead - everything will be dedicated to the programming of our events. What you get: Our biggest Thank you! If you are a parent, you'll be presented with a voucher, good for a certain amount to be spent at our center. If you are a business, you'll have an opportunity to promote yourself with Center Makor-Natick. Cetner Makor is a 503 non-profit, so all your donations are tax deductible. The ImpactIt's not a secret anymore - Russian school education creates a better impact on a student and helps student to succeed in college and get a better job after that.  Therefore, Russian Schools of Mathematics are so popular today in the United States. But not only Mathematics, that maters. When we talk about Russian education, we talk about the ways we train our kids to understand science and engineering principles. Kids with skills gained through taking a variety of Russian-originated classes learn faster and in depth, and score higher on the SAT and other tests.  We hope, bringing this center to the Metrowest community of Greater Boston, we are giving a chance to local families to provide their kids with higher level of education at affordable cost.  Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Share our program on your timeline and in groups - Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin and others.
Ask your company management to contribute something on your behalf
Tell your friends about Center Makor and invite kids to join us
Volunteer your hours to our Center in Natick 
Help to spread a word about Center Makor - Natick and its wonderful programs for kids available on a daily basis. 
In-kind donations are always welcome! Right now, we are looking for Lego pieces, stand up right piano, and folding tables! 
Thank you very much! Your Involvement is essential for this program to succeed. If you have any questions, please contact me sasha@centermakor.org ***All Donations are tax deductible***

story:
Our Story

The ICEF coaching staff helped the student athletes make this short movie to help raise some much needed funding for our rugby and cultural tour to England and France later this month.

The Impact

This trip will have a life changing effect on these students.  To travel, meet new people, see new places, and experience new things never fails to change people's views on the world and themselves. This trip will also affect the people we meet by introducing them to a great group of students from South Los Angeles. 

What We Need & What You Get

In reality, we need a lot more than our $25,000 goal, but this is a total we think it realistic for this campaign. We really appreciate our current sponsors who help us reach our goals every year.  Your donation will help pay for the airline tickets to Europe, transport around once we are there, hostels when we aren't being hosted and meals. In addition it will be used for entrance to cultural sites and the professional rugby game we are seeing in Exeter!

Other Ways You Can Help

We want you to donate, but you can also help by spreading the word, posting our video on your Facebook page or Twitter account, or just emailing your friends.  Please use our 'Share Now' button

story:
My Vision 

The world has already met the exceptional Ryan Seacrest. 

We are living our best life because of the incomparable Oprah Winfrey. 

So, who will be the next great T.V. host of this generation? 

                                               

Well family and friends, I believe that it is I, Mr. Cornell Davis.

Everything that we do on this earth is a seed being planted in the universe. We can plant seeds through our actions, and we can plant seeds with our words.

The greatest seed that is planted in each individual is the seed for the soul. It is this seed planted in our Soul that will ultimately be the driving force that motivates us to live the life that we are destined to achieve. The seeds that we should be planting in each person’s life are motivation, inspiration, and empowerment. When those three seeds are watered and nurtured, the tree of people’s dreams will be manifested.

                                                

Being a host and speaking to people has been something that has been ingrained in me from a very young age. I always knew I had a huge heart and that my greatest gift was to plant seeds in people that would help make a difference in their lives.

Now, in order for me to be sharp and prepare to face the fierce competition that awaits me in this great land of L.A., I have to be properly trained. As we all know, in order to be successful, it is important to get the right type of training and experience, which is becoming more and more expensive.

                                              


    Today, I am asking all of you who have known me for any length of time, to help me raise $2000.00 dollars for the hosting and acting training that will be necessary throughout the next year. Every dime you give will be used to help me master the craft of being a phenomenal host. It will also be used to support the creation of a dynamic reel, which is an essential component   needed to showcase my talent to agents, casting directors, and a variety of  online and traditional TV shows.

    Whatever your heart leads you to give, whether it’s $1.00 or $500.00, be assured that it will be used in every possible way to help me strengthen, and effectively  use the seed God has put inside of me.

     Thank you in advance for your support. I love you all.

                                              Who Is Cornell


                                                    

    Born April 16, 1987 in San Bernardino, California, Cornell Davis always knew he had a heart for people, and that his greatest gift was to help people in a way that would make a difference in their lives. Growing up as a pastor’s kid, Cornell knew that he was called to a much larger audience than a traditional church.

    After graduating from high school, Cornell attended Vanguard University of Southern California in Costa Mesa. It was there that he received his Bachelors of Science Degree in Sociology. After graduating from Vanguard University with his degree, Cornell was still very uncertain about what path he wanted to take next. 

                                                      

     

    Knowing he always had a heart for entertainment and hosting, Cornell felt this was the perfect time to pursue his dreams. He quickly relocated to Los Angeles to pursue his hosting career on a professional level. Soon after arriving to Los Angeles, Cornell was presented with an opportunity to co-host the Gospel Mix Show with DJ El Vee on 102.3 KJLH in Los Angeles. For two years on Sunday mornings, Cornell presented his inspirational words of positivity to thousands of listeners on a weekly basis.

    Today, Cornell’s vision and goal is to plant seeds of encouragement on a global scale, while also creating new and exciting entertainment.

                                                         

    Thank You for Being One with Cornell!

story:
Hello

My name is Tom,

I was born and bred in Burton on trent.  I work as an Historical Interpreter. It is my job to research various stories from our past and re interpret them for a modern audience.  I have been fortunate enough to work with some of the most exciting heritage organisations such as English Heritage, The British Museum and The Tower of London.

I love working with Primary schools as it give me the opportunity to show how fun and interactive our history can be.  

The L.I.T.E (Life in the Trenches Experience) will offer the same chance to explore and interact with Burton's heritage.

Using nearly Fifteen years of experience, i am keen to show a fun, friendly and free way to Commemorate the centenary of the 1914-1918 Great War. 

BUT...We cant offer a memorable experience like this without your support!!!

The Life in the Trenches Experience  or L.I.TE. for short, will offer people of all ages an amazing opportunity to walk in the shoes of our great grandfathers and great grandmothers.  Our ancestors risked so much to secure our future.

L.I.T.E will stand to celebrate their achievements.

THE PROJECT DETAILS...

We have secured a plot of land on the Burton Washlands to start creating A TRENCH!!

The volunteers of this project will work tirelessly over two weeks to dig a small section of a front line trench....by hand!!

The plucky volunteers will be treated to hard tack and plum and apple jam.

Once completed, the local community will have the chance to explore the trench and even lay a sand bag in memory.

Local schools will have free workshops in and around the trench as well as a longer lasting memories project to take back to their schools.


FUNDING BREAK DOWN

Because, for environmental reasons, we can't actually dig down into the earth.  (the water table is too high) we have to import nearly 400 hundred tonnes of soil onto the washlands.  This has big financial implications.

Moving the earth from it's original position onto the washlands will cost the project £3000.  This is a huge amount of money to raise, but without the soil,  we cannot start the project

The digging and shaping will be free, dug lovingly by an army of volunteers.

The trench will be shored up by corrugated iron and wooden planking.  This important aspect of the trenches safety will cost the project £750

L.I.T.E will be feeding our volunteers every day, to help keep their strength up.  This will cost the project £250

I have already raised £500 which will help cloth the volunteers in historically accurate garb.

In total: SOIL and Transportation           £3000

                Materials, Wood and Iron          £750

                Food and drink for volunteers  £250         

               Total needed to achieve a finished project   £4000

Everything else including the schools workshops will be provided for free by Tingtang Theatre company.  A burton based History and event company.

If every business owner in Burton and nearby districts pledge just £3, We will be able to offer a completely free centenary memories project for the whole community.

If you would like to pledge a larger amount of money, i would be very happy to discuss advertising opportunities for you and your company. 

please contact me on 07734 704055

or email me at tom@tingtang.org to discuss and queries before investing.

Thank you so much for your time

Thank you for your support

Tom fermor

Historical Interpreter, Tingtang theatre and History Company

story:
The Veterans & Community Resource Center (VCRC) is a South Florida-based community organization with a commitment to assisting the disadvantaged residents of our communities as well as U.S. Veterans. Our mission is to assist our fellow citizens in obtaining healthcare and access to a variety of state and federal benefits. These include programs such as SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program), Medicare, and Medicaid.

This year, we have established a new location in St. Petersburg, Florida, to further expand the communities that we serve. Despite our current limited facility, we are taking on the needs of the community as soon as they are brought to us, and that is where your help comes in.

In partnership with the University of Faith, the Veterans & Community Resource Center is working to raise money for a state of the art technology center in our St. Petersburg office to be utilized by the university’s student athletes. The technology center will also be utilized by the veterans that VCRC services day-to-day. 

The University of Faith is a flagship institution committed to upholding personal integrity, leadership, high standards of academic performance, and the transmission of Christian values. Based in St. Petersburg, Florida, the University of Faith's bible education offers online degree and diploma programs to prepare Christians for leadership positions as pastors, ministers, teachers, mission workers, and community servants for the Lord while emphasizing Christian character. For more information about the University of Faith, visit http://www.universityoffaithfl.org/


In addition to its online centralized academic program, the University of Faith also has an athletic department which includes a football team, golf team, basketball team, and an outdoor track and field team.

These student athletes need a place they can use as a study lab and meet with GED, SAT, and general studies tutors. A place that will foster an academically-focused community atmosphere that they can't necessarily feel at home.

Education is an important part of every community and it is our duty to help provide the materials needed to help these student athletes achieve their academic goals. We want to put these young men and women in a position to not only make a difference in their own lives, but also make a difference in the lives of others whether now or in the future. And this will establish a foundation for many student athletes to come after them.

Technology is quickly becoming the major way in which applications and other forms concerning Federal and State benefits are filled out, submitted, and monitored. Knowing this, VCRC wants to administer computer classes specifically catered to the veterans we service. We want to enhance their knowledge of internet and computer usage, as to not have them fall behind and be forgotten in this ever evolving world of technology.

story:
We are several representative of 4 different organizations which common work are different fields of hemp.

1. The Greens - they work to reborn the hemp industry in Bulgaria in all aspects.

2. Liberty 420 -  they work for free market and drugs legalization.

3. Promena (change) - works for decriminalization of hemp.

4. Medical Marijuana Bulgaria - organization for integrating the medical marijuana.

We think that our cause is important not only for the people of Bulgaria, but for all EU countries.

We plan to start a wave of seminars in all European countries after the first one, which we want to make in Sofia, Bulgaria. The seminar will show all popular aspects of hemp industry as medical use, production of paper, clothes, construction materials etc. There will be economic module, which will show the perspectives of the industry in general.

What We Need & What You Get:

We need 2 000 EUR to organize the first seminar in Sofia. This includes- rent for a hall in the most popular building NDK ( The palace of culture) ; rent for sound and multimedia; catering and security. All lectures will be made by volunteers, which are part of every organization, for free.

If you donate more than 50 euros you will get a reserved place in the front lines of the hall + specially selected photos from the event with some clarifying text.

If you donate more than 200 euros you will get a reserved place in the first line or if you can't come to the event you will receive a free dvd with the seminar recorded. 

Please help us to start one good initiative which can grow across all Europe and will help people to understand what is the truth about hemp!

Our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/weedliketotalkbulgaria

You can donate bitcoin at: 1EGZLwe7k1sDdRzoSJjL9jdsL9uYCxVS2b

story:
You Can Invest in Hope and Opportunity for Children in Need!

If you believe that the future depends on what we do today, then you can make a difference for the children of SouthSide Early Childhood Center!

We empower at-risk girls and boys through quality early education, dramatically increasing their likelihood of graduating from high school and college and living good, healthy, productive lives. 

Did you know that early childhood education for low-income children is the most powerful job training tool? And, did you know that every $1 invested in early education for at-risk kids today results in $16 savings tomorrow in lower prison costs, less crime and other consequences of low educational achievement?

We are the oldest early childhood provider in the entire Midwest and having operated in just two facilities for 128 years, we are building a new school!  The foundation is poured, the walls are up, and the roof is on.  The only thing missing is the kid’s furniture! 

We’ve got 10 classrooms to fill; five for precious infants and toddlers and five for rambunctious pre-schoolers.  Cubbies, chairs, dramatic play materials, water tables, books, mini-kitchens and cozy cubes will create a great atmosphere of learning for 148 children.

Please help the girls and boys of SouthSide find their furniture by making a gift today.  A child’s environment impacts their expectations of life, so you can raise their sights by helping us furnish their new classrooms. 

All gifts are tax deductible, plus you get a cool gift in return!  Most importantly, every mastered letter of the alphabet, every word scribbled in crayon, every shriek of laughter of these special girls and boys will be made possible because you cared.  Thank you.

The SouthSide Story

For 128 years, SouthSide Early Chidhood Center has nurtured, educated and inspired boys and girls from low-income working families in the City of St. Louis. Our exceptionally high-quality early childhood program nurtures and educates children, building a strong foundation for school and life success. Through early education, intervention for disabilities and mental health challenges, and parent support and engagement, we close the achievement gap for our children before kindergarten.

This summer, we are moving from our 60-year old building to a beautiful new early childhood center where we can serve even more children, expanding from 98 to 148, ages six weeks to pre-kindergarten.

This campaign will enable us to fill our beautiful new classrooms with the new furniture and learning materials that our children deserve. With your help we will continue to enrich the lives of young children in need. Your investment in our children will pay great dividends in their lives, setting the stage for success.

Let's Spread the Word!

Got friends? Please tell them what SouthSide is doing to make a difference in the lives of children that may have been born into disadvantage, but with our help and their parents' support, are on their way to a much brighter future!

Please get the word out on your social networks - use the great Indiegogo share tools to give everyone you know a chance to learn about what we do and invest in our children.

 

PERKS!

For a $50 donation, you will receive an attractive coffee mug with the SouthSide logo! 

 A $100 donation delivers a sturdy water bottle to your door, just in time for summer!

If you choose to invest $250 in our project, we will send you both the coffee cup and water bottle, as well as a selection of delicious chocolates made by our neighbor, Kakao Chocolate.

Our top perks will commemorate your gift with your own inscribed brick, placed in our sidewalk along the front of our building. If you choose this level, we will be in touch to confirm your choice of inscription.
